meta.label: Emailing data partitions
meta.description: This recipe partitions data, then emails the data partitions as CSV files or embedded HTML tables to recipients. Emailed data partitions can be optionally saved in a folder

inputRoles.name: input_dataset
inputRoles.label: Input dataset
inputRoles.description: This is the input dataset that will be partitioned

outputRoles.name: output_folder
outputRoles.label: Output Folder
outputRoles.description: This is the folder where the data partitions will saved

params.name: sender_name
params.label: Sender name (required)
params.description: Enter email sender name or'On the Behalf of (put your name here)'.

params.name: use_recipient_email_column
params.label: Use recipient email column
params.description: Check this box if the recipient emails are in a column in the input dataset

params.name: recipient_email_column
params.label: Column with recipient email
params.description: Enter the column name that contains the emails of the recipients. This column name should be in the input dataset

params.name: recipient_emails
params.label: Recipient email(s)
params.description: Use this field to enter recipent email address(es) inline if recipient emails are not in the input dataset: all data partitions will be sent to each of these recipient emails. Separate email addresses with commas

params.name: cc
params.label: CC
params.description: Email addres(es) in the CC field. Separate email addresses with commas

params.name: bc
params.label: BC
params.description: Email addres(es) in the BC field. Separate email addresses with commas

params.name: file_format
params.label: File format
params.description: Select the file format of the data to be sent through email

selectChoices.label: CSV attachement and Embedded HTML table

params.name: use_email_body
params.label: Use email body
params.description: Checking this box allows you to write the email body text if needed

params.name: email_body_text
params.label: Email body text
params.description: Provide the text of the email body. You can use the partitioning column value in the text by using the variable {partition}. For example: Hi, this is the {partition} data

params.name: partitioning_column
params.label: Partitioning column
params.description: Name of column in the input dataset whose unique values will be used to filter data partitions

params.name: columns_to_exclude
params.label: Columns to exclude
params.description: These are the columns to exclude in the dataset or data partitions to email. For example, you may want to exclude the email column in the final data partition to be sent through email. Use commas to separate columns

params.name: write_data_to_folder
params.label: Write data partitions to folder
params.description: Check this button to write emailed data partitions to folder

params.name: include_timestamp
params.label: Include timestamp to CSV file names
params.description: Check this button to include timestamps to csv file names. The default file name is the value of the partitioning column used to create the file

params.name: clear_folder
params.label: Clear folder
params.description: Check this button to clear the folder before writing new CSV files
